TITLE: Kevin McCarthy’s Speaker Drama Raises New Fears on Debt Limit
SUMMARY: An emboldened conservative flank and concessions made to win votes could lead to a protracted standoff on critical fiscal issues, risking economic pain.

TITLE: Fed Officials Ask How to Better Understand Inflation After Surprises
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve officials, including Lisa Cook, a board member, are wrestling with how to think about price increases after 18 months of rapid change.

TITLE: US Jobs Report: Employers Added 223,000 Jobs in December
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve’s moves to cool the economy with higher interest rates seem to be taking gentle hold. Wage growth lost momentum.

TITLE: Disney Is Bringing Employees Back Four Days a Week
SUMMARY: The C.E.O., Robert A. Iger, said in a memo that he thought the move would benefit the company’s culture and creativity.

TITLE: Britain’s Economic Health Is Withering With Sick Workers on the Sidelines
SUMMARY: Many people who want to work can’t because of long-term health problems, a persistent issue that is causing Britain’s economy to go “into reverse.”

TITLE: Powell Says Fed ‘Will Not Be’ a Climate Policymaker
SUMMARY: In a speech on Federal Reserve independence, Chair Jerome H. Powell emphasized that climate change should be addressed by elected officials.

TITLE: As Infrastructure Money Lands, the Job Dividends Begin
SUMMARY: Trillions of dollars in government spending will profoundly affect the labor market, but in ways hard to measure, and mostly under the surface.

TITLE: UK Economy Withers as Covid Puts Workers on the Sidelines
SUMMARY: Many people who want to work can’t because of long-term health problems, a persistent issue that is causing Britain’s economy to go “into reverse.”

TITLE: Why Hitting the Debt Ceiling Would Be Very Bad for the U.S. Economy
SUMMARY: If Congress fails to increase the government’s borrowing limit in time, the result would be a shock to the economy and financial markets.

TITLE: Fed President Backs Slowdown as Support Mounts for Smaller Rate Move
SUMMARY: Susan M. Collins, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston, said she was leaning toward a quarter-point move at the central bank’s Feb. 1 meeting.

TITLE: Powell Says Fed Will Not Be a ‘Climate Policymaker’
SUMMARY: In a speech on Federal Reserve independence, Chair Jerome H. Powell emphasized that climate change should be addressed by elected officials.

TITLE: U.S. Will Hit Debt Limit Jan. 19, Yellen Tells Congress
SUMMARY: The Treasury Department expects to begin taking “extraordinary measures” to continue paying the government’s obligations ahead of what’s expected to be a big fight to raise the borrowing cap.

TITLE: U.S. Will Hit Debt Limit on Thursday, Yellen Tells Congress
SUMMARY: The Treasury Department expects to begin taking “extraordinary measures” to continue paying the government’s obligations before what is expected to be a big fight to raise the borrowing cap.
